workflow.name: Automate Apollo lead scraping & email enrichment to Airtable CRM with Apify
workflow.description:
# Apollo Lead Scraper to Airtable CRM

Automate your lead generation by scraping targeted prospects from Apollo.io, enriching with contact details, and seamlessly syncing to Airtable for organized outreach‚Äîall without manual data entry.

## What It Does

This workflow pulls search URLs from Airtable, uses Apify to scrape Apollo leads (up to 50k), enriches with emails and LinkedIn profiles, removes duplicates, filters valid entries, and categorizes contacts into Airtable tables based on email availability for efficient CRM management.

## Key Features

- **Apify Apollo Scraper** - Extracts up to 50k leads with personal/work emails
- **Smart Deduplication** - Removes duplicates based on key fields like email and name
- **Email Categorization** - Separates contacts with/without emails into dedicated tables
- **Field Mapping** - Customizable data transformation for Airtable compatibility
- **Configurable Limits** - Adjust total records and memory for optimal performance
- **Error Handling** - Built-in troubleshooting for common issues like invalid URLs

## Perfect For

- **Sales Teams**: Build targeted B2B pipelines for email campaigns
- **Recruiters**: Source candidates by job title, location, and skills
- **Marketers**: Create datasets for market research and analysis
- **Agencies**: Automate client prospecting from custom filters
- **Researchers**: Collect professional data for industry studies
- **CRM Managers**: Maintain clean, enriched contact databases

## Technical Highlights

Leveraging n8n's Airtable and Apify integrations, this workflow showcases:
- Dynamic data fetching from Airtable tables
- Actor-based web scraping with custom parameters
- Conditional branching for data routing
- Efficient data processing with set, filter, and if nodes
- Scalable design for large datasets with memory optimization

Ideal for automating lead workflows and scaling prospecting efforts. No advanced coding needed‚Äîjust set up credentials and run!

parameters.content:
# Apollo Lead Scraper to Airtable CRM

## üìã What This Template Does
This workflow scrapes leads from Apollo.io search URLs via Apify, enriches with emails and LinkedIn data, removes duplicates, and syncs to Airtable‚Äîseparating contacts with/without emails for streamlined CRM outreach.

## üîß Prerequisites
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
- Apollo.io account with search URLs
- Airtable base with "URLs" table (for input) and two contact tables ("with Email" and "without Email")

## üîë Required Credentials

### Airtable OAuth2 API Setup
1. Go to Airtable Builder Hub > OAuth integrations
2. Register new integration, paste n8n redirect URL
3. Copy Client ID/Secret to n8n credential
4. Select scopes: data.records:read, data.records:write, schema.bases:read
5. Connect account and grant base access

### Apify API Setup
1. Log in to Apify Console > Settings > Integrations
2. Copy API token
3. Add to n8n as Apify API credential

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Steps
1. Import workflow JSON into n8n
2. Assign credentials to nodes
3. Set Airtable base/tables in "Get URL" and create nodes
4. Add Apollo search URL to "URLs" table
5. Activate workflow

## üéØ Use Cases
- Enrich sales pipelines with B2B leads for targeted emails
- Automate agency prospecting from Apollo filters
- Source tech job candidates via title/location searches
- Build educational datasets for marketing analysis

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Troubleshooting
- No leads: Validate Apollo URL (must be people search); check Apify logs
- Airtable errors: Re-grant scopes; test node output solo
- Duplicates: Adjust "Remove Duplicates" keys (e.g., email+name)
- Timeout: Reduce totalRecords to 500; monitor Apify memory

parameters.content:
## üì• Get URL

**Purpose:** Fetches Apollo search URL from Airtable.

**Key Settings:**
- Base: Your Airtable base ID.
- Table: "Apollo URL" or equivalent.
- Operation: Search (list all records).

**Note:** Ensure table has a "URL" field with valid Apollo people search links.

## üîç Scrape Leads

**Purpose:** Runs Apify actor to scrape leads from Apollo URL.

**Key Settings:**
- Actor: Apollo Scraper.
- Custom Body: Enable personal/work emails, set totalRecords (e.g., 1200).
- Memory: 4096 MB for larger scrapes.

**Note:** Validate URL is a people search; monitor Apify usage limits.

## ‚úèÔ∏è Node: Edit Fields

**Purpose:** Maps and renames scraped data fields for Airtable.

**Key Settings:**
- Assignments: Map fields like name, email, company details.

**Note:** Handles nested organization data; adjust if Apollo output changes.

## Remove Duplicates & Filter

**Purpose:** Deduplicates leads and filters those with websites.

**Key Settings:**
- Remove Duplicates: Default options (compares all fields).
- Filter: Website exists.

**Note:** Customize duplicate keys (e.g., email + name) in troubleshooting.

## üîÄ Nodes: If & IF

**Purpose:** Branches based on email presence (work/personal).

**Key Settings:**
- Conditions: Check if email or personal_email exists.

**Note:** Routes to appropriate Airtable tables; ensures no null emails in "with Email" table.

## üì§ Email Present, Personal email present, Email Absent

**Purpose:** Creates records in Airtable tables based on email availability.

**Key Settings:**
- Operation: Create.
- Columns: Mapped fields; use $ifEmpty for email fallback.

**Note:** Update base/table IDs; re-auth if permission errors.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
